entry.title: App validation update: Announcing the launch of the enhanced App validation tool in Developer Portal!
entry.summary:
If you're an ISV developer, our updated App validation tool lets you evaluate your app packages using the same test cases Microsoft uses for reviews. It identifies errors or warnings in app manifests, basic info, and bot capabilities, providing clear guidelines for resolution. Developers now get detailed success, error, and warning statuses based on new bot capability scenarios, helping them fix issues before submission.

entry.title: Platform update: Share code snippets as richly formatted Adaptive Cards
entry.summary:
The CodeBlock element enables you to share code snippets as richly formatted Adaptive Cards in Teams chats, channels, and meetings. Adaptive Cards with the CodeBlock element make the code snippet easy to read as the indentation, numbering, and syntax highlighting match the programming language.

entry.summary:
The dashboardCards property in the app manifest defines a list of cards that can be pinned to a dashboard such as Microsoft Viva Connections, providing a summarized view of app details.

entry.summary:
You can now implement authentication in API-based message extensions to provide secure and seamless access to the applications. If your message extension requires authentication, add the authorization property under composeExtensions.

entry.title: Platform update: Use Adaptive Card-based Loop components to build collaborative experiences
entry.summary:
Adaptive Card-based Loop components enable you to build collaborative experiences within your Microsoft Teams message extensions that work across Microsoft 365. Adaptive Card-based Loop components have actionable content that enables users to make live updates without having to switch context between Microsoft 365 apps, such as Teams and Outlook. Adaptive Card-based Loop components require Adaptive Cards version 1.6 or later.

entry.summary:
API-based message extensions are a type of Teams app that integrates your chat functionality directly into Teams, enhancing your app's usability and offering a seamless user experience. You can now build API-based message extension using Developer Portal for Teams.

entry.title: Platform update: Introduced Teams Toolkit CLI v3
entry.summary:
Teams Toolkit command line interface (Teams Toolkit CLI) is a text-based command line interface that accelerates Teams application development. It aims to provide keyboard centric experience while building Teams applications. We recommend that you use Teams Toolkit CLI v3 to build your Teams app. TeamsFx CLI v1 and TeamsFx CLI v2 will soon be deprecated.

entry.title: Platform update: Extend a Teams message extension across Microsoft 365
entry.summary:
Message extensions allow users to interact with your web service using buttons and forms. Users can search or initiate actions in an external system from Microsoft Teams and Outlook by extending your Teams apps across Microsoft 365. There are two types of message extensions:Search-based and Action-based message extensions.

entry.title: Platform update: The captureImage API
entry.summary:
The captureImage API enables users to activate the camera and capture an image or select media from the gallery. When the captureImage callback is triggered, the image is shared as a file. The API restricts users to either select or capture a single image for sharing and is compatible only with mobile clients.
